settings_sections.title: Connect with CopperCrm
settings_sections.description: The following information is required in order to connect with your CopperCrm instance.  You can find these values in your CopperCrm instance by clicking `Settings` then in the `Integrations` section click `API Keys`

settings_sections.title: Lead - Identity
settings_sections.description: Identity is one of the most important concepts in Hull. Try to configure the identity before doing anything else. By default email is configured as the primary identifier for leads. If you need another identifier please contact your Hull customer success representative

settings_sections.title: Lead - Fetching Leads from CopperCrm
settings_sections.description:
Hull gives it's customers the ability to capture changes on specific data fields so that they are kept up to date in real-time. Please configure the fields that you would like pulled from CopperCrm below.

Add a mapping by clicking "Map an attribute". To create a new attribute in Hull, you may type in the attribute name in the "Hull Attribute" box on the right and hit enter to create a new attribute.

settings_sections.title: Opportunity - Identity
settings_sections.description: Identity is one of the most important concepts in Hull. For Opportunities, you must specify the "Type" of opportunity. This could be a field which represents New, Upsell, Growth. The Opportunity Type is used as a way to group opportunity attributes together on accounts or users. That way you're more efficiently able to segment accounts and users by the different types of opportunities. If the Opportunity Type field is blank on the Opportunity, Hull will not ingest it. Additionally if you have multiple opportunities of the same type on an account or user, the attributes will likely overwrite each other, so be careful what field you use. Please contact your Hull representative for more guidance if needed
